solution.text:
Radius of the circle with diameter=D, \(R=\frac D2=_{{j*12}}_\)
Similarly Radius of the circle with diameter d=\(r=\frac d2=_{{j*5}}_\)
Area of the shaded region=\(\pi*r^2+\pi*R^2\)
Now let us say the radius of the new circle with area equal to the shaded region be R
so,\(\pi*R'^2=\pi(R^2+r^2)\)
\(\Rightarrow R'^2=(R^2+r^2)\)
\(R'=\sqrt {_{{j*12}}_^2+_{{j*5}}_^2}\)
\(R'=_{{j*13}}_\)

content.text:
Find the radius of the circle whose area is equal to area of the shaded region in the given figure.
(D=_{{2*j*12}}_ and d=_{{2*j*5}}_)
